definitions.definition: a particular part or feature of something.
examples: the financial aspect can be overstressed
synonyms: slant "the photos depict every aspect of life"

definitions.definition: a specific way in which something can be considered.
examples: from every aspect, theirs was a changing world
the air of desertion lent the place a sinister aspect
synonyms: feeling "his face had a sinister aspect"

definitions.definition: the positioning of a building or thing in a specified direction.
examples: a greenhouse with a southern aspect

definitions.definition: the side of a building facing a particular direction.
examples: the front aspect of the hotel was unremarkable

definitions.definition: a particular position of a planet or other celestial body relative to another, as measured by angular distance.
examples: the sun in Aries formed an adverse aspect with Uranus in Capricorn

definitions.definition: a grammatical category or form that expresses the way in which time is denoted by the verb.
examples: the semantics of tense and aspect

definitions.definition: (of a planet) form an aspect with (another celestial body).
examples: the sun is superbly aspected by your ruler Mars on the 19th
